abstract.para: All tasks that need to be managed by a cluster must be available as a resource. There are two major groups here to consider: resource agents and &stonith; agents. For both categories, you can add your own agents, extending the abilities of the cluster to your own needs.

sect1.title: &stonith; Agents
sect1.para: A cluster sometimes detects that one of the nodes is behaving strangely and needs to remove it. This is called fencing and is commonly done with a &stonith; resource. All &stonith; resources reside in /usr/lib/stonith/plugins on each node.

warning.title: SSH and &stonith; Are Not Supported
warning.para: It is impossible to know how SSH might react to other system problems. For this reason, SSH and &stonith; agent are not supported for production environments.

sect1.para: To get a list of all currently available &stonith; devices (from the software side), use the command stonith -L.
As of yet there is no documentation about writing &stonith; agents. If you want to write new &stonith; agents, consult the examples available in the source of the heartbeat-common package.
